## Overview

This structure enables you to lock an animation at its starting frame for a period of time before beginning. You can also lock an animation to its ending frame for a specified amount of time after it finishes, or both.

An animation applies the fill mode you choose when a range determined by [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimStart], [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimEnd], or [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimDuration] exceeds the animation’s underlying duration, which the framework calculates as the frame count (see [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/frames-2j4nj]) multiplied by the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/frameInterval], multiplied by [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationDefinition/speed].

For example, if you set the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationDefinition/trimStart] property for an animation of a hand waving to `-1.0` and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/fillMode] to [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationFillMode/backwards] or [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationFillMode/both], the hand displays immediately, freezes at the first animation frame for one second, and then begins to wave.

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationFillMode
crawled: 2025-12-01T12:06:22Z
---

# AnimationFillMode

**Structure**

Options that determine which animation frames display outside of the normal duration.

## Declaration

```swift
struct AnimationFillMode
```

## Overview

This structure enables you to lock an animation at its starting frame for a period of time before beginning. You can also lock an animation to its ending frame for a specified amount of time after it finishes, or both.

An animation applies the fill mode you choose when a range determined by [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimStart], [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimEnd], or [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationView/trimDuration] exceeds the animation’s underlying duration, which the framework calculates as the frame count (see [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/frames-2j4nj]) multiplied by the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/frameInterval], multiplied by [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationDefinition/speed].

For example, if you set the [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationDefinition/trimStart] property for an animation of a hand waving to `-1.0` and [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/SampledAnimation/fillMode] to [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationFillMode/backwards] or [doc://com.apple.RealityKit/documentation/RealityKit/AnimationFillMode/both], the hand displays immediately, freezes at the first animation frame for one second, and then begins to wave.

## Choosing a fill mode

- **none**: An option that indicates an animation doesn’t display frame data outside of its normal duration.
- **forwards**: An option that freezes the last frame of the animation until it stops.
- **backwards**: An option that shows the first animation frame while playback progresses to the beginning position.
- **both**: An option that displays the animation’s initial frame or final frame when playback occurs outside of the normal duration.

## Creating a fill mode

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a fill mode from its backing data type.

## Animation definitions

- **SampledAnimation**: An animation that cycles through a series of frames at a constant interval.
- **TweenMode**: Options that determine whether an animation switches between frames gradually or abruptly.
- **FromToByAnimation**: An animation that starts, stops, or increments by a specific value.
- **AnimationTimingFunction**: The pacing of an animation transition.
- **AnimationView**: An animation that represents a variation of another animation.
- **OrbitAnimation**: An animation that revolves an entity around its origin.
- **AnimationDefinition**: The configuration, including target object, timeframe, and visual semantics, of an animation.
- **AnimationGroup**: A collection of animations that play simultaneously.
- **AnimationHandoffType**: The type of handoff the play animation method performs between a current animation and a new animation.

## Conforms To

- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- OptionSet
- RawRepresentable
- SetAlgebra
